intro: Viguiera atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viguiera atacamensis is adapted to extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient species in the Atacama Desert.
